Posted By: Villainous1 (11/3/2011 2:03:15 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Yeah, I find it amusing that this is easily the beefiest looking werewolf... which I guess works considering what a beast she is in wolfmode. Anyway, I have a couple of her as gravy on the "run right over the top of you" ridiculousness with mayors, immerwolves, and instigator gangs. The damage output is so ludicrous.  
  
Ok, new favorite thing to do with this she-beast... soulbind her with [Nightshade Peddler](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Nightshade Peddler). Then just for mass murdering grins, slaughter someone's entire creature board with [Revenge of the Hunted](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Revenge of the Hunted). That's livin' the dream when you're double strike, deathtouching everything in sight.
posts.html:

Posted By: marwinshieldscale (9/22/2011 2:42:29 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
My signature card, and she is one beautiful beast. I run her in my werewolf tribal, and so I usually win by playing an [Increasing Savagery](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Increasing Savagery) on her and giving her trample with either [Full Moon's Rise](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Full Moon's Rise) or [Rancor](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Rancor).  
  
Me: "So that's a 10/10 double strike trample that can only be blocked by two or more creatures coming your way on turn 4. Problem?"  
Opponent: Aaaahhh! (flips table)  
  
It occurs to me that if I were really evil, I could shell out $200 for a playset of [Berserk](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Berserk). Now that would be cruel.
posts.html:
